item.title: Chapters
item.description: Chapter 1: The Computational Library This chapter introduces the concept of computational research and thinking in libraries. It covers (i) the basic concept of text mining, (ii) the need for text mining in libraries, (iii) understanding text characteristics, and (iv) identifying different text mining problems, which include document classification/text categorization, information retrieval, clustering, and information extraction. It presents various use cases of libraries that have applied text mining techniques and enumerates various costs, limitations, and benefits related to text mining.
